arm_group.description: Blood (approximately equal to 3 to 4 tablespoons) will be drawn at the Wills Eye Institute, 1 time.

biospec_descr.textblock: The level of TSP1 and PEDF in the vitreous and plasma.

brief_summary.textblock:
You are being asked to be in a research study to determine blood levels and vitreous levels
      of compounds called thrombospondin 1 (TSP1) and pigment epithelium derived factor (PEDF).
      These  compounds exists naturally in your body.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study to Determine Levels of Thrombospondin-1 and Pigmented Epithelium Derived Factor Levels in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
The hypothesis tested here is that diabetic patients that express the higher molecular
      weight pigment epithelium-derived factor  (PEDF) isoform have lower thrombospondin-1 (TSP1)
      level and, as a result, are at a greater risk for the development of more severe diabetic
      retinopathy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ability to provide written informed consent and comply with study assessments for the
             full duration of the study

          -  Diabetes Mellitus

          -  Undergoing pars plana vitrectomy for any reason

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Use of any anti-VEGF (vascular endothelial growth factor ) medications

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diabetes mellitus who are undergoing pars plana vitrectomy for any reason

intervention.description: 3-4 tablespoons of blood will be drawn, one time.

facility.name: Mid Atlantic Retina- Wills Eye Institute

clinical_study.official_title: Modulation of Thrombospondin-1 and Pigment Epithelium Derived Factor Levels in Vitreous Fluid and Plasma of Patients With Diabetes

primary_outcome.description: Your voluntary participation in this study may help determine how different TSP1 and PEDF levels correlate with diabetic eye disease.
primary_outcome.measure: Level of thrombospondin (TSP1) and pigment epithelium derived factor (PEDF) in the vitreous and plasma

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
